_header: George Barcroft will borrow of any that dare lend
_description: Do not trust George Barcroft — two couplets (a third added alia manu)

CamJes74.Transcription:
George Barcroft will borrow of any that dare lendeBut to paye againe
                    he doth never intendWherefore the lender is verie vnwiseAnd the
                    borrower is knaw by good adviseThen the borrowers a knave & þe
                    lender a foolAnd for to learn well hee need go to school
CamJes74.Note:
First two couplets added by a sixteenth-century hand; second couplet
                    crossed out and later hand added third further down the page.
CamJes74.Editions:
James,  Montague Rhodes. 
             A Descriptive Catalogue of manuscripts in the Library of Jesus College,
                Cambridge.
         Cambridge: at the UP, 1895: 111.
